These issues are in the search results only, and look fine on the saved variants page. - Also, the saved recessive SV search seems to only have SNVs/ Indels in the results. **Link to page(s) where bug is occurring** Recessive SV results - https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/results/d8f98d563b866d36c29b6488a04f1e51?page=1&sort=in_omim Search page - https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/family/F031020_rgp_1525 **Scope of the bug** Likely in other cases too **Screenshots**

title: A logging error while loading RNAseq data
body:
**Describe the bug**
When loading RNA-seq data, there are some logging errors (see the followings) on the console of my local environment.
```
--- Logging error ---
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/shifa/opt/anaconda2/envs/mito/lib/python3.7/logging/__init__.py", line 1025, in emit
    msg = self.format(record)
  File "/Users/shifa/opt/anaconda2/envs/mito/lib/python3.7/logging/__init__.py", line 869, in format
    return fmt.format(record)
  File "/Users/shifa/opt/anaconda2/envs/mito/lib/python3.7/logging/__init__.py", line 611, in format
    s = self.formatMessage(record)
  File "/Users/shifa/dev/seqr/seqr/utils/logging_utils.py", line 40, in formatMessage
    return json.dumps(log_json)
  File "/Users/shifa/opt/anaconda2/envs/mito/lib/python3.7/json/__init__.py", line 231, in dumps
    return _default_encoder.encode(obj)
  File "/Users/shifa/opt/anaconda2/envs/mito/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 199, in encode
    chunks = self.iterencode(o, _one_shot=True)
  File "/Users/shifa/opt/anaconda2/envs/mito/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 257, in iterencode
    return _iterencode(o, 0)
  File "/Users/shifa/opt/anaconda2/envs/mito/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 179, in default
    raise TypeError(f'Object of type {o.__class__.__name__} '
TypeError: Object of type set is not JSON serializable
Call stack:
  File "/Applications/PyCharm.app/Contents/plugins/python/helpers/pydev/_pydev_bundle/pydev_monkey.py", line 770, in __call__
    ret = self.original_func(*self.args, **self.kwargs)
  File "/Users/shifa/opt/anaconda2/envs/mito/lib/python3.7/threading.py", line 890, in _bootstrap
    self._bootstrap_inner()
  ...
    return view_func(request, *args, **kwargs)
  [Previous line repeated 1 more time]
  File "/Users/shifa/dev/seqr/seqr/views/apis/data_manager_api.py", line 390, in load_rna_seq_sample_data
    model_cls.bulk_create(request.user, [model_cls(sample=sample, **data) for data in data_by_gene.values()])
  File "/Users/shifa/dev/seqr/seqr/models.py", line 1052, in bulk_create
    cls.log_model_no_guid_bulk_update(models, user, 'create')
  File "/Users/shifa/dev/seqr/seqr/models.py", line 1044, in log_model_no_guid_bulk_update
    logger.info(f'{update_type} {db_entity}s', user, db_update=db_update)
  File "/Users/shifa/dev/seqr/seqr/utils/logging_utils.py", line 56, in info
    self._log(logging.INFO, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/Users/shifa/dev/seqr/seqr/utils/logging_utils.py", line 50, in _log
    self._logger.log(level, message, extra=dict(user=user, **kwargs))
Message: 'create RnaSeqOutliers'
Arguments: ()

```

The logging fails for `logger.info(f'{update_type} {db_entity}s', user, db_update=db_update)` because the `db_update` has a set field that can't be dumped to a string while formatting with `json.dumps(log_json)`.

An example value of `db_update` is `{'dbEntity': 'RnaSeqOutlier', 'numEntities': 1, 'parentEntityIds': {'S1730134926_RGP_123_3'}, 'updateType': 'bulk_delete'}` when the error happens. The cause of the error is that the `parentEntityIds` data is a set.

The error can be fixed easily by converting the set field to a list. But we should do more because these errors have never been caught by tests since the logger is always mocked in the tests.

The example RNAseq data I was loading has the following data.
```
sampleID	geneID	detail	pValue	padjust	zScore
RGP_123_3	ENSG00000240361		0.04	0.112	1.9
```
**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**


**Scope of the bug**


**Screenshots**

title: CRAM files won't load (local deployment)
body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/broadinstitute/seqr/discussions/3232
Originally posted by **jemunro** February 20, 2023 **Describe the bug** We have a local deployment of seqr on our HPC which is working well overall, however I can't get CRAM files to load for read visualization. BAM files work fine. I've tested the same CRAM files on the IGV JS web app and they work fine there, so I'm not sure what the issue is. I'm using the GATK reference genome (Homo_sapiens_assembly38.fasta) to create the BAMs and CRAMs. The error message is: "BAM header error: bad magic number. This could be caused by either a corrupt or missing file." **Screenshots**

title: Variant search bug
body:
**Describe the bug**
Variants in the results list go missing when I choose to 'unpair' variants in an unrelated gene. In the example here, I ran a recessive permissive search. The results included compound heterozygous variants in COL6A6. There were also poor quality variants in MUC4, so I selected unpair to remove the pairs. This took away many other variants in other genes including COL6A6, HSPG2 and others. 

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**
Recessive permissive search results - https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/results/8472467c924bca1f317ccdf92289cf65?page=1&sort=pathogenicity

Results after selecting unpair - https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/results/8472467c924bca1f317ccdf92289cf65?page=1&sort=pathogenicity

**Scope of the bug**
Noticed it in RGP_1157 today. Not sure of other cases. 

**Screenshots**

title: Overwrite of "Analysed by" names in seqr projects
body:
**Describe the bug**
At some point this week all "Analysed by" categories in the RGP HMB and GRU projects were changed such that each data type is now listed as analyzed by a member of the Ops team (Marcky Antonio or Jillian Serrano, who do not do analysis in seqr) rather than the analyst who actually worked on the case. As far as I can tell, the analyzed by dates were not changed. Can the names be restored?

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**
Examples here: https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/project/R0594_rare_genomes_project_gen/family_page/F033126_rgp_2113
https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/project/R0624_neurodev_wave1_kenya/family_page/F039448_860_27511526

**Scope of the bug**
I see the same phenomenon in other projects, though different team members names have been added (eg Stacey Hall in the Neurodev_Wave1_Kenya project)

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67653781/215128041-a0b1aca5-2f4f-4b26-8065-57c107c0a121.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67653781/215129316-feefb2ef-d23f-4598-9f65-efaea8a2de0d.png)

```
 - Insufficient 'CPUS' quota. Requested 120.0, available 24.0.
 - Insufficient 'CPUS_ALL_REGIONS' quota. Requested 120.0, available 32.0.
 - Insufficient 'IN_USE_ADDRESSES' quota. Requested 15.0, available 8.0.
```

Thanks,
David Murdock

title: Time-sensitive - sample metadata page not loading
body: **Describe the bug** Related to issue: Time-sensitive - data for grant submission #3177 **Link to page(s) where bug is occurring** https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/report/sample_metadata/all Waited 15+ minutes but the page still hasn't loaded.

title: Wrong Decipher link
body:
**Describe the bug**
The link leading to DECIPHER webpage is incorrect, it leads to the wrong coordinates. please use Hg38, not HG19 for all the CNVs

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**
Any seqr page with a CNV
Ex: https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/project/R0284_pierce_retinal_degenerat/saved_variants/family/F021157_ogi1770/Known%20gene%20for%20phenotype

https://www.deciphergenomics.org/search/patients/results?q=19%3A54609974-54635124
DECIPHER has the wrong coordinates here 

**Scope of the bug**
yes, multiple projects

title: text entries on family page
body:
**Describe the bug**
I am unable to erase the "coded phenotype" and "post-discovery OMIM" fields on family page. I click on it, erase the text and click submit, no changes was applied. I can only replace it with other text (in this case, I added the word" none") , but would like to have the fields empty here. Is this possible to go back to an empty field for these entries after some text had been added? 

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**
https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/project/R0474_cmg_sherr_exomes/family_page/F025264_she_3357

**Scope of the bug**
It happened in other families, I can provide more links if needed. 

**Screenshots**
![Screen Shot 2023-01-17 at 3 24 17 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84086816/213005106-54ce9944-3bce-4cce-b1dd-ad438710fc25.png)

title: Issues navigating to tagged variants using 'Saved Variants' bar
body:
**Describe the bug**
There seems to be a new bug with the saved variants bar at the top of the 'Saved Variants' page for individual cases. Typically, when you click on a specific tag category within the saved variants bar (i.e. analyst high priority, review, KGP, etc.), you will be immediately shown all variants with that tag for _that specific family_. Today, the analysts noticed that clicking on a specific tag category within the saved variants bar causes seqr to load for several minutes and then show you all variants with that tag _across the entire project_.

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**
Example: Clicking on the orange 'analyst high priority' section of the saved variants bar on https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/project/R0623_neurodev_wave1_sa/saved_variants/family/F039660_859_18256634 brings you to https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/project/R0623_neurodev_wave1_sa/saved_variants/Analyst%20high%20priority, which shows all analyst high priority variants across the entire NeuroDev_Wave1_SA project, rather than just for that specific family.

**Scope of the bug**
Seems to be happening across multiple projects - I've noticed it in both NeuroDev and RGP.

title: Unable to add an assigned analyst to cases
body:
**Describe the bug**
I am trying to assign analysts to cases in the NeuroDev_Wave1_Kenya project but am not able to. After clicking the 'edit' icon next to Assigned Analyst on the family page, I entered Ike's email address and clicked 'Submit,' but the assigned analyst field remains blank. 

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**
https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/project/R0624_neurodev_wave1_kenya/family_page/F039415_860_65800681 

**Scope of the bug**
I specifically ran into this in the NeuroDev_Wave1_Kenya project, but I quickly checked a few other projects (Neurodev_Wave1_SA and CMG_Beggs_WGS) and seem to have the same issue in those as well.

title: Custom search times out when using chr coordinates
body: **Describe the bug** Custom search for variants in a defined chromosomal location by entering the coordinates does not seem to be going through, despite waiting at least 5 mins and trying again. **Link to page(s) where bug is occurring** https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/report/custom_search/f6967d2fe206eb18e6436ba172882642?page=1&sort=xpos **Scope of the bug** NA **Screenshots**

title: Gene expression data
body: **Describe the bug** When RNASeq data has been loaded for a case, it typically shows the OUTRIDER plot on the Family page, and the option to see expression levels for the gene on the variant page. Not sure if both are loaded at the same time, as it is seems that there is no graph of expression levels on the variant page for BON_B21-58 **Link to page(s) where bug is occurring** (https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/project/R0312_cmg_bonnemann_genomes/saved_variants/family/F038254_bon_b21_58) **Scope of the bug** This case currently **Screenshots**

title: Annotation files for genome 37 not available anymore at ENSEMBL
body: **Describe the bug** We are using SEQR with genome 37 version for SEQR analysis, annotations dataset for this genome version are not available anymore and we can not install new SEQR servers using this command : ``` BUILD_VERSION=37 docker-compose exec pipeline-runner download_reference_data.sh $BUILD_VERSION ``` Can you provide a procedure to install the needed files ? **Link to page(s) where bug is occurring** This link does not give access to genome 37 version anymore http://ftp.ensembl.org/pub/release-99/fasta/homo_sapiens/dna/ **Scope of the bug** We are not able to load annotation data for the pipeline runner analysis with genome 37 version. **Screenshots** Here are the error messages we get :

title: Phenotype-based prioritization: Exomiser table upload error.
body:
Uploading gs://bw-proj/seqr-bw/project__phenotypes/2022_11_21__seqr_test/RGP_56_3_exomiser.for_seqr.tsv
to https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/data_management/phenotype_prioritization currently produces this error:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6240170/205713659-465abf09-1497-49c9-81f5-b77beba63149.png)
In the table, most scores are numbers, but some are empty string (to indicate "None") and the error is likely caused by that. 

The expected behavior is that missing scores are stored in the database as None and then shown as blank in the details view:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6240170/205713852-5369008d-0eac-41b6-8d2c-a11de61e8eb6.png)

title: Public gene notes not being saved
body: **Describe the bug** Public gene notes not being saved on the gene page when selecting the 'add to gene notes' on the variants page. **Link to page(s) where bug is occurring** https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/results/41b9c5e25f036abfd78b7c3fb8a81390?page=1&sort=in_omim **Scope of the bug** Not tested in other projects **Screenshots**

title: Case review status dropdown menu not loading
body:
**Describe the bug**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is, and what you instead expect to be happening
The Case Review dropdown menu does not fully load so I am unable to change a family's case review status. I wanted to change RGP_931's status to Accept but Inactive was the only option that I was able to select.

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**
https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/project/R0384_rare_genomes_project_gen/case_review

**Scope of the bug**
Originally found in RGP_931 but appears to affect all families with a shorter list of details (RGP_945 and lower)

**Screenshots**
![Screen Shot 2022-12-01 at 3 48 27 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/119630154/205157261-042f20f4-8897-4fd6-abcd-bdc21ff653b5.png)
![Screen Shot 2022-12-01 at 3 52 47 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/119630154/205157279-e8065b8a-e09f-4c85-a889-0bdbf0d3c4e7.png)

title: IGV not loading
body: **Describe the bug** IGV in seqr is not loading for multiple projects/ new data tho crams were recently loaded (per Stacey). Not sure if this is a seqr issue or to do with the crams. **Link to page(s) where bug is occurring** https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/results/54c2e59a4abef329c34e25b4f5c74f80?page=1&sort=in_omim **Scope of the bug** Multiple projects, mostly newly loaded samples **Screenshots**

title: Login causes ERR_TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS
body:
**Describe the bug**

Clicked "Sign In" on the seqr home page. Logged in to my Google account. The page throws `ERR_TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS`. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8867295/203423837-9a379d0d-e3e2-45ca-8374-9a4785034171.png)

Looked at network requests, can see repeated thrashing.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8867295/203423887-1f19037c-151b-46a9-b151-ff3ef7d95b5e.png)

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**

https://seqr.broadinstitute.org

title: MME matches not displayed
body: **Describe the bug** After submitting to MME, seqr page states, No Matches'. However, I got an email with the list of matches. **Link to page(s) where bug is occurring** https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/... **Scope of the bug** [Are you experiencing this issue in all projects? Within specific families within one project? ](https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/project/R0594_rare_genomes_project_gen/family_page/F039234_rgp_2248/matchmaker_exchange) **Screenshots**

title: AC and H/H field do not show input text
body: **Describe the bug** A clear and concise description of what the bug is, and what you instead expect to be happening I noticed that, when I get to the variant search page, some of the "customize search" fields (including AC, H/H, etc) don't show what text is being input. I was trying to limit AC to 10 but when I typed "10", the field looked blank and I didn't know if anything was being registered. **Link to page(s) where bug is occurring** https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/... https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/results/237812f66356297b10e870349b2fdc89?page=1&sort=xpos **Scope of the bug** Are you experiencing this issue in all projects? Within specific families within one project? I haven't tried this in other projects, but have done this for NeuroDev. We've got an old seqr instance that was manually installed back in 2017 that I'm interested in migrating to the newer version using the seqr docker-compose. I've tried a couple of things based off [this issue from 2020](https://github.com/broadinstitute/seqr/issues/1440):

1. I've created a data dump using the command `pg_dump -U postgres seqrdb | gzip -c - > backup.gz`
2. I then started the seqr docker-compose (`docker-compose up -d seqr`) and entered the postgres container, and ran these commands to drop the database and replace it with my backup: 
```
psql -U postgres postgres -c "drop database seqrdb"
psql -U postgres postgres -c "create database seqrdb"
psql -U postgres seqrdb <  <(gunzip -c backup.gz)
```
This all seems to run fine.

I then do:
3. `python -m manage makemigrations`

title: Utility function `file_iter` doesn't support local .gz format VCF files
body:
**Describe the bug**
When we open a local .gz file (e.g., a compressed VCF file) to do validation, the `file_iter` function uses `dd` command to read the required range of data. But it doesn't use `gunzip` to decompress the data even when the `raw_content` parameter is set to False.

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**
The bug is found when debugging the VCF validation feature. When we provide a local `.gz` file to the function `validate_vcf_and_get_samples`, it'll fail.

**Scope of the bug**
No end-user functions use the `file_iter` function to fetch non-raw contents. So the bug won't affect the end users.
Simply adding `gunzip` may not solve the issue. The file could be a `block gzip` file. The output may need decoding to get Python strings. So it requires careful consideration for the solution.

**Screenshots**
No screenshots

title: Blank page when opening the project page after refreshing project variant search page
body: **Describe the bug** Open the `Project Variant Search` page, and click on the refresh button of the browser, then open the project page by clicking on the "backward" button or the link back to the project page. See details in the below picture. The blank page looks like the below picture. The debug console shows `TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined` as below. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33550059/187301268-a811d122-c596-4e52-8cbe-3346582afd60.png) **Link to page(s) where bug is occurring** The bug can be shown on this page https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/project/R0486_cmg_gcnv **Scope of the bug** Same for all projects. **Screenshots** I can repeat the bug locally and found that the error happens if the `family.analysedBy` is undefined. The source code that the bug happens is [here](https://github.com/broadinstitute/seqr/blob/5faca9685c78a7b4b2c826c38027b808cb606b67/ui/pages/Project/selectors.js#L335-L340)

I am already the admin user and I should be able to see the dataset (Edit Dataset link) instead of just the Load Additional Data modal. I will be modifying the code accordingly.

title: state.pagenesById can return wrong data because Panel App gene data is not unique on Ensembl ID
body: FANCI is amber in the [White matter disorders - childhood onset](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/496/) Panel App gene list, but green in the [Tumour predisposition - childhood onset](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/243/gene/FANCI/) list. If you select one list and then the other in the Search Form Panel, and switch back and forth between them, you get a bit of a caching error where FANCI may appear in the wrong box for the selected list, green/amber. I think this is because `getLocusListsWithGenes` in redux/selectors.js is using getPaGenesById but it isn't specifying the LocusListGuid, so we can get the wrong info. This issue is more apparent with #2790, but it could silently be affecting people on production. It's hard to notice this bug. It does not seem to affect displaying the correct color & MOI in the search result VariantGene, because we fetch the panelAppDetails in a different way when returning the search results.

title: Variant pathogenicity
body: **Describe the bug** A variant marked as one-star pathogenic in seqr, is actually benign per Clinvar. There are currently no records in Clinvar indicating it is pathogenic. It is possible the path entry was deleted from Clinvar, but seqr has not been updated to reflect this change. Submitting a ticket just to make sure this is not a bug. **Link to page(s) where bug is occurring** seqr page - https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/variant/11-31789912-CT-C/family/F030436_kan_1456 Clinvar page - https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/clinvar/variation/1278291/?oq=1017445[alleleid]&m=NM_001368894.2(PAX6):c.*21del%20(p.Ter437=) **Scope of the bug** Likely variant specific. **Screenshots**

title: pipeline-runner not running because of missing Bio/EnsEMBL/Registry.pm in docker image
body: **Describe the bug** We have installed the latest docker image of SEQR pipeline last week. ``` root@vls186-seqr:/opt/seqr/data# docker images REPOSITORY TAG IMAGE ID CREATED SIZE gcr.io/seqr-project/seqr gcloud-prod 18237846b371 2 hours ago 2.28GB gcr.io/seqr-project/seqr 8a95d454e45c 5 days ago 2.28GB gcr.io/seqr-project/pipeline-runner gcloud-prod 24b0cc0a5772 12 days ago 3.79GB elasticdump/elasticsearch-dump latest a5057a00907a 3 weeks ago 278MB docker.elastic.co/elasticsearch/elasticsearch 7.16.3 3a5e93284781 3 months ago 611MB docker.elastic.co/kibana/kibana 7.16.3 df64a680d590 3 months ago 1.3GB gcr.io/seqr-project/redis gcloud-prod 98d2caf140c6 5 months ago 113MB postgres 12.6 145bb83bd157 11 months ago 314MB ``` When running the pipeline-runner using this command : ``` root@vls186-seqr:/opt/seqr# cat fam126.sh BUILD_VERSION=37 SAMPLE_TYPE=WES INDEX_NAME=fam126 INPUT_FILE_PATH=INPUT/FAM126.vcf docker-compose exec pipeline-runner load_data.sh $BUILD_VERSION $SAMPLE_TYPE $INDEX_NAME $INPUT_FILE_PAT ``` after a few minutes we have this error message : `Can't locate Bio/EnsEMBL/Registry.pm in @INC (you may need to install the Bio::EnsEMBL::Registry module) (@INC contains: /ensembl-vep-release-99/modules /ensembl-vep-release-99 /etc/perl /usr/local` **Scope of the bug** When running pipeline-runner with an VCF file for input the processing stop with error messages. **Screenshots** I have uploaded a few screenshot of the problem and the log messages file. [seqr_log_adlab.txt](https://github.com/broadinstitute/seqr/files/8557643/seqr_log_adlab.txt) .

title: PedigreeImg shown in FamilyLayout in PopupWithModal is broken
body: Original issue: To reproduce 1. Navigate to a trio. 2. Do a search. 3. For one of the variants, hover over the family link, and pause a moment. https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/results/a4eecaa83cc728c9cff264a994eb1500?page=1&sort=xpos --- David: The problem is that FamilyLayout.jsx is given "leftContent" from Family.jsx, and then tries to draw it with only 3/16ths of the space, and rightContent is given 13/16ths of the space. See: --- One part of the problem can be solved using `width: 100%;` CSS on PedigreeImg in LazyPedigreeImagePanel.jsx. This stops the overlapping, but makes the Pedigree Image unreadable. **Design 1)** A better solution is to also change the width given to leftContent, to 7/16ths, and give the main "fields" part 9/16ths: **Design 2)** It would be better to put the PedigreeImg in rightContent instead of leftContent, so that users with slow internet don't experience jarring "[Pop in](https://web.dev/optimize-cls/)" when the image loads, shoving the text to the side. **Design 3)** Using `float: right;` would be better in this case than rightContent, because it would allow the text to wrap and wouldn't waste space. But this is a bit hacky and might have side effects on other components. **Design 4)** Stacking the PedigreeImg would be helpful for families with pedigrees larger than Trios **Design 5)** Image on bottom, to prevent "pop in" on slow internet. **Design 6)** Just increase the size of the Pop up Modal? No example screenshot sorry. Which approach would be best for SeqR, @hanars?

title: Long project category names can't be shown in dropdown
body: Long category names can't be shown in the dropdown on the main dashboard: This can be helped by changing the text to "All project categories", and setting `min-width: 14em;` However, the width of the dropdown is still not dynamic and does not grow with longer names. A better, but slightly hacky solution is to use a display:table, and set: ``` div.visible.menu.transition { display: table !important; } ``` Adding `border-top: solid 0.5px #96c8da !important;` makes it look nicer, but I'm hard-coding the color here. Is there a better/preferred way of doing this? Note that it will still try to make the dropdown menu as narrow as possible, and break on spaces.

title: Spelling error in help text
body:
Spelling error in help text

To reproduce:

1. Navigate to the variant search page.
2. Expand the Inheritance panel.
3. Click on the help text `(described here)` link.

The text contains:

> Finds variants where all affected indivs have at least one alternate allele and all unaffected are homozygous reference.

`indivs` should read `individuals`.

title: Gene List dropdown sometimes does not match a loaded Saved Search
body:
**Describe the bug**
If the user has started a search and set a Gene List, and then selects a Saved Search which does not have a Gene List, the Location search panel's Gene List dropdown is not cleared.

The Location search panel's genes, variants, etc. are all set/blanked correctly, it is just the dropdown component which is not receiving the correct value.

If the Saved Search has a Gene List, the dropdown is set correctly.

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**
https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/

**Scope of the bug**
All projects, Broad, MCRI, Garvan.

**Screenshots**
Original reproduction instructions from @drtconway
1. Navigate to the variant search page
![Screen_Shot_2022-03-23_at_11 32 19_am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3320713/161173607-10f4433f-4007-4008-9094-9e9fa77fc51e.png)

2. Select a saved search and a gene list.
![Screen_Shot_2022-03-23_at_11 32 42_am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3320713/161173633-ec0098ed-365a-4823-bd4d-be0fec6e1000.png)

3. Search. In this case, you can see there is just one result.
![Screen_Shot_2022-03-23_at_11 33 20_am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3320713/161173670-767bbfd7-9877-4f2e-8f3b-cbdf26cbae37.png)

4. Change the saved search, but don't touch anything else. Note the gene list box shows the gene list you used earlier.
![Screen_Shot_2022-03-23_at_11 33 35_am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3320713/161173689-2e17b5f2-35c8-4dc8-b6ea-c6e1f83ce431.png)

5. Search. Notice that in this case it returns 53 results.
![Screen_Shot_2022-03-23_at_11 33 54_am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3320713/161173701-51b7dfef-1211-4f89-bd01-f1c4019b2f7e.png)

6. Navigate back to the project page, then back to the variant search page.
7. Select the saved search you used in step 4, and the gene list you used, and search. Notice there are only 11 results now.
![Screen_Shot_2022-03-23_at_11 34 29_am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3320713/161173712-9cc2ab00-a6ae-474e-bab0-c631608e2d52.png)

It appears that when a different saved search was selected in step 4, the gene list was cleared in the internal state, but not in the UI, and the search was performed with no gene list applied.

title: Conflicting variant counts with some comp hets
body:
**Describe the bug**
In variant count results there seems to be a problem with counting comp het pairs a bit like in  #2539 

To illustrate: using the Seqr_Demo project do a variants search specifying i) all families ii) recessive restrictive inheritance and iii) location gene TTN. The results say "Found 2 variants".  Inspection shows there are two comp het pairs in the results, each of which includes the variant  2-178730621-T-A. Downloading the results in xlsx format gives a spreadsheet with 4 data rows, two of which are duplicates i.e. there are actually three distinct variants. So is the number of variants in this result 2, 3 or 4? I think of the result as 2 diplotypes, comprised of 3 distinct variants. I suggest the results page  summary ("Found 2 variants") should be reworded and that the content of the spreadsheet/tabular downloads should be non-redundant.

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**
https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/results/a630381d02eda1f98211e13fddc171e7?page=1&sort=xpos

**Scope of the bug**

title: ACMG Calculator state update bug
body:
To reproduce:

1. go to an unclassified variant
2. Open the ACMG Calculation dialogue.
3. You should see
Score = 0, Classification = Unknown, Criteria Applied = No criteria applied.
4. Toggle BS1_P from N to Y.
5. You should see
Score = -1, Classification = Likely Benign, Criteria Applied = BS1_P.
6. Now toggle BS1_P back to N.
7. You should see the same as step 3 above, but instead you see 
Score = -1, Classification = Likely Benign, Criteria Applied = No criteria applied.

I am observing this behaviour on the MCRI instance, but I don't believe there are any downstream (MCRI specific) changes that could be remotely relevant.

![Appearance at step 3.](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22288081/159382804-b089a79e-a9f2-42c3-b18e-d0371534ee66.png)

![Appearance at step 5.](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22288081/159382816-80f16d86-cbc8-4766-a0ae-12467272e553.png)

![Appearance at step 7.](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22288081/159382827-b99b50f5-0889-4123-b3b4-a6c8950beb8c.png)

title: Do not run entrypoint migrate commands until seqr pod connects to postgres
body:
The dev seqr pod did a full redeploy, and when it did the check in entrypoint.sh for whether the database exists the command failed because the pod wasn't able to connect to postgres at all yet, so it started running all the "new database" commands to run migrations, load fixture data, load reference data, etc. Sometime in the middle of running these commands the pod was able to start connecting to postgres and those commands switched from erroring that they couldn't connect to postgres to actually running. For some of them (the `loaddata` commands) they harmlessly errored out because the data was already loaded. For the load reference data commands, it actually dumped all the records in the reference database and reloaded the data. 

we should update our deployment so the entrypoint doesn't run the migrate commands until it can successfully connect to postgres

Logs: https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=resource.type%3D%22k8s_container%22%0Ar[…]tamp=2022-03-12T08:24:13.035609780Z?project=seqr-project

title: Recessive filters not working correctly with the LOF SV annotation
body: This issue was recently discussed in our analyst team meeting: **Describe the bug** SVs annotated as LOF are not being returned in a standard recessive search (even though the LOF structural consequence is included in the search parameters). This is likely due to the new variant display format for recessive variants. The LOF annotation is typically displayed next to the gene, but this appears to be affected when an SV is in trans with an SNV/indel. In the examples below, the TRAPPC9 and CAPN3 deletions are returned when searching for all SVs with LOF selected in the annotations section, but they are not being returned in a recessive search. **Link to page(s) where bug is occurring** Here are two examples: 1. TRAPPC9 in HK011 - https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/results/1aff2108990160100da1881cb9d1d4ac?page=1&sort=pathogenicity 2. CAPN3 in MANT020 - https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/results/b2a7c806bb5c67544312f2e90d4b982f?page=1&sort=pathogenicity **Scope of the bug** Across all seqr projects with SV data. **Screenshots** This TRAPPC9 SV is **not** returned in a standard recessive search with LOF selected under annotations, even though the deletion is annotated as LOF: If 'deletions' are added under annotations in a recessive search, the variant **is** returned but the LOF annotation is lost, which might be why it isn't being returned in our current standard recessive search: ![Screen Shot 2022-02-11 at 10 30 40 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57765157/153620193-1c4212ca-c755-4b30-9984-e0088f28926f.png)

title: Local install SeqrVCFToMTTask key not found error - bump hail version
body:
**Describe the bug**
This is quite a benign bug and has an easy fix.
When running pipeline-runner through docker-compose on a local install of seqr, a keynotfound error is raised: `java.util.NoSuchElementException: key not found: GRCh37` (see attached log file). This seems to be related to the version of Hail (I was running hail 0.2.74), as it has been reported [here](https://github.com/hail-is/hail/issues/10722), and fixed [here](https://github.com/hail-is/hail/pull/10888). Minimum version of hail to avoid this issue is [0.2.77](https://hail.is/docs/0.2/change_log.html#version-0-2-83).
Issue fixed by opening a bash terminal inside the container and running `pip install hail==0.2.77`
Could you update the hail version in hail-elasticsearch-pipelines requirements.txt file to >=0.2.77?

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**


**Scope of the bug**
Are you experiencing this issue in all projects? Within specific families within one project?

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.
[pipeline-runner hail error.txt](https://github.com/broadinstitute/seqr/files/8020706/pipeline-runner.hail.error.txt)

The Case Review page for the RGP Genomes project is not working correctly. It only loads if the user scrolls down while on the page. When loaded, a few actions cause the entire page (not just the family results) to 'crash' and go completely blank. These actions include using the search bar, editing the 'Assigned analyst' field. This is impacting RGP Genomes project, but we have not been in any other projects. I think that we are the only group that uses Case Review, so others may not have noticed if there is an issue in other projects.

title: Unusual variant search results in CMG_NeuroDev_WES
body: **Describe the bug** I've been noticing some strange variant search behavior in several of the new NeuroDev cases that were loaded on 12/16/2021. When I run our standard de novo/dominant permissive or recessive restrictive and permissive searches, several variants are being returned in which none of the family members (including the proband) appear to have any alt alleles. Do you have any idea why this might be happening? **Link to page(s) where bug is occurring** I've noticed this in several cases so far, but here are just a few examples: https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/results/6de3e7681befe287ad34e9b9393dc54d?page=1&sort=protein_consequence https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/results/2d07263ef26f30e150ecc0ffa24012f2?page=1&sort=protein_consequence https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/results/6861abf8e4f3978b329bb0040ee22557?page=1&sort=protein_consequence **Scope of the bug** I checked a few other projects and have not seen this issue come up anywhere else. It also only seems to be happening with the latest batch of NeuroDev cases (not every single case, but the majority that I've checked). **Screenshots** Example of search results from a de novo permissive search: ![Screen Shot 2022-01-07 at 3 17 17 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57765157/148601951-44ab9ca5-a42a-4a22-afcc-dd8df9e9a8ff.png) Taking a closer look into one of these variants, it appears that this issue is only occurring in the NeuroDev case, and that the variant behaves normally in all other projects:

title: RECESSIVE search is getting reset to HOMOZYGOUS_RECESSIVE
body:
If we select **RECESSIVE** search, then run it, change a single parameter on the form (say, frequency) and resubmit the form, **RECESSIVE** in the form changes to **HOMOZYGOUS_RECESSIVE**. I doubt it should happen because it would confuse the user who would think that the search was **RECESSIVE** but then sees **HOMOZYGOUS_RECESSIVE**. The issue happens because of the following line:

https://github.com/broadinstitute/seqr/blob/master/seqr/utils/elasticsearch/es_search.py#L384

And the search is later on returned and the form is updated with the new inheritance filter value. Shouldn't we copy **inheritance_filter** instead to prevent such behavior?

title: Expected variants in ZC4H2 not found by seqr
body:
We have a project/VCF (hg19) that contains multiple unrelated individuals and we know that 4 of the subjects each have one causal variant in ZC4H2. No matter what mode of inheritance I use / what filter parameters, I can't get these variants to show up except if I do a search by coordinates and provide the gene's coordinates. Then, some of the variants show up in the results but are not listed as being in the gene (no annotations/impact). Presumably the lack of impact/annotation to ZC4H2 is the immediate cause of why they're not showing up in regular variant search but I'm not sure why they're not annotated correctly. 

The variants are:
X:64138986 TG>T  frameshift
X:64139056 G>A stop_gain/nonsense
X:64139085 C>A splice_acceptor
X:64139960 C>T splice_donor

I'm attaching a VCF slice for this gene. The VCF contains annotations generated by VEP through our non-seqr pipeline and you can see that VEP annotates the consequences and gene correctly.

title: Request for higher permissions on project CMG_Neurodev_WES for user Nick Buser - nbuser@broadinstitute.org
body:
**Describe the bug**
I have been working with Kayla Delano (kdelano@broadinstitute.org) and Stacy Mano (smano@broadinstitute.org) to upload data into the seqr project 'CMG_Neurodev_WES running' on the Broad's seqr instance. To support the project I need to upload new participant ids, edit individuals, and edit families, however my permissions levels seem to limit me to just editing of already existing family-id subject-id pairs (using the Bulk Edit Individual Metadata form). I am not sure which exact permission levels the application recognizes but I will need to at least update the current family ids and create new family and individual records. My seqr user account should be under nbuser@broadinstitute.org 

Kayla requested that I create this ticket as her github access is not working properly at the moment but ask for any questions about the process to be directed to her. Apologies if the bug tag is not exactly right for this request, it seemed preferable over feature request but still not exactly accurate.

**Expected behavior**: On clicking the button titled "edit families and individuals" within the Overview section and under "X Families, Y Individuals" subheader a popup window opens with tabs allowing access to forms for individual editing, individual creation, family editing, and family creation. 

**Current behavior**: The button within the Overview section and under "X Families, Y Individuals" subheader is titled "Bulk Edit Metadata" and clicking it opens a popup window with no tabs only permitting editing of already existing subjects.

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**
https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/project/R0526_cmg_neurodev_wes/project_page

CMG_Neurodev_WES popup window content opened on clicking 'edit individuals'/'edit families and individuals'/'bulk edit metadata' button

title: Recessive searches return variants above the allele frequency cutoff
body:
**Describe the bug**
The saved recessive restrictive and permissive searches appear to (and were intended to) have a gnomAD allele frequency cutoff of 1%. However, after running these searches, many variants are returned with popmax AF >1% in continental subpopulations (e.g. AFR, EAS). An example result with gnomAD subpopulation allele frequency data is below. I think this actually happens for any search where inheritance is set to recessive (not just the saved searches).

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**

title: Annotation Failure Running Locally
body:
**Describe the bug**
I am attempting to follow the instructions on https://github.com/broadinstitute/seqr/blob/master/deploy/LOCAL_INSTALL.md#option-2-annotate-and-load-on-prem to annotate my VCFs.  I successfully installed seqr and got it up and running.  I have also downloaded the VEP and loftee data and placed them as well as the VCFs in the expected locations.  Then I run `docker-compose up -d pipeline-runner` and `docker-compose exec pipeline-runner /bin/bash` successfully to create a shell in the pipeline-runner container, but the command given,
```
python3 -m seqr_loading SeqrMTToESTask --local-scheduler \
    --reference-ht-path /seqr_reference_data/combined_reference_data_grch38.ht \
    --clinvar-ht-path /seqr-reference-data/GRCh38/clinvar/clinvar.GRCh38.2020-06-15.ht \
    --vep-config-json-path /vep85-GRCh38-loftee-gcloud.json \
    --es-host elasticsearch \
    --es-index-min-num-shards 3 \
    --sample-type WES \
    --es-index your-dataset-name \
    --genome-version 38 \
    --source-paths  /input_vcfs/GRCh38/your-callset.vcf.gz \
    --dest-path /input_vcfs/GRCh38/your-callset.mt
```
has multiple problems.  `/vep85-GRCh38-loftee-gcloud.json` does not exist.  I looked in the root directory of the container and found instead `/vep-GRCh38.json` and after replacing the `--vep-config-json-path` parameter with this file instead.  Additionally the `--reference-ht-path` argument should be prefixed with `/seqr-reference-data` instead of `/seqr_reference_data`, the `--clinvar-ht-path` should instead be `/seqr-reference-data/GRCh38/clinvar.GRCh38.2020-06-15.ht`.

So here is my actual command:

$ python3 -m seqr_loading SeqrMTToESTask --local-scheduler \                                                                                                                                
--reference-ht-path /seqr-reference-data/GRCh38/c
clinvar.GRCh38.2020-06-15.ht/      combined_reference_data_grch38.ht/ 
--reference-ht-path /seqr-reference-data/GRCh38/combined_reference_data_grch38.ht \
--clinvar-ht-path /seqr-reference-data/GRCh38/clinvar.GRCh38.2020-06-15.ht \

--genome-version 38 \

title: Add Emily Groopman as CMG staff level seqr user
body:
**Describe the bug**
Can you add Emily Groopman to CMG staff level of slack
egroopma@broadinstitute.org
Thank you!

title: Can't show reads under the family panel
body:
**Describe the bug**
When opening a project and scrolling down to a family panel in it, click on the "SHOW gCNV" or "SHOW READS" buttons as in the picture below. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33550059/139305854-d8e54cb9-a81b-46d2-85b0-300e53c2e87b.png)
The page goes blank and there are error messages in the debugger as in the figure below.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33550059/139306576-7e73acde-9b31-4167-8239-f4240cc126b2.png)


**Link to page(s) where the bug is occurring**
https://seqr-dev.broadinstitute.org/project/R0486_cmg_gcnv/project_page

It looks like that the code fails to check the undefined `variant` in the statement below.
```
  const size = variant.end && variant.end - variant.pos
```

title: Unable to view HGVS annotations in local install
body:
**Describe the bug**
I am unable to view HGVS annotations for variants (I've never been able to since installing local seqr version). I've dumped psql references databases and recreated to check that wasn't the reason.

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**
All variant pages

**Scope of the bug**
Across all projects

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23638585/138961170-d8e9d969-c432-440e-9361-24dc37d89d4a.png)

**FYI**
I have upgraded to the latest version of seqr - which has fixed the issues of #2231. As an aside, panelApp isn't working. I note there is a panelapp folder within the docker seqr container. Happy to open a separate issue for this.

title: Cannot download tables in seqr
body:
**Describe the bug**
We have a local install of seqr using docker. As of a few days ago, have been unable to download any tables in seqr. The pop-up when opening the download appears blank. 

I've checked all looks healthy in docker and everything is reporting as healthy. I have tried recomposing docker and I'm getting the same issue. Everything else works fine though.

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**
Happening on local install, but happy to provide login details if required.

**Scope of the bug**
All projects. Unable to download any tables.

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23638585/138847216-3eca5f73-5e91-4221-8a47-4b87761a0429.png)

Would appreciate some advice please.

title: Cannot move past the first page of variant search results
body:
**Describe the bug**
I am not able to see beyond Page 1 of variant search results that include multiple pages of variants. Neither clicking the arrow to move to the next page or clicking a different page number seems to be working (the screen remains on the current page).

title: Cannot create analysis groups
body:

Unable to create an analysis group - it let's me select all but if I try to select 2 or more projects, it only let's there be 1 check box at a time.

title: Gene-level seqr link not working
body:
**Describe the bug**
Clicking the 'seqr' link next to a gene name to find other tagged variants in that gene is bringing me to a blank page.

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**
Example variant: https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/variant/9-35723452-T-A/family/F030637_rgp_1393
Clicking the link brings me here: https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/summary_data/saved_variants/ALL/ENSG00000137076

**Scope of the bug**
Across all projects. Confirmed with other analysts that they're experiencing the same issue as well.

title: Pedigree Image Not Updating
body:
When existing Individual IDs are updated or new Individuals are added to an existing Family, the pedigree image on the family page is not updating to reflect the changes. This issue seems to have started when the new pedigree look was launched. 

Three examples:
https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/project/R0384_rare_genomes_project_gen/family_page/F029946_rgp_1174
https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/project/R0384_rare_genomes_project_gen/family_page/F031021_rgp_1526
https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/project/R0384_rare_genomes_project_gen/family_page/F031753_rgp_1760

This appears to be an issue for any family that has individuals edited in the RGP Genomes Project.

title: Bulk Edit Individual Metadata options don't match manual edit options and importing FALSE does not work
body:
For several fields on the Bulk Edit Individual Metadata page the import options "true, false, or blank if unknown" do not match the manual edit options "Yes, No, Unknown".

Attempting to bulk import these fields using TRUE correctly flags respective fields as "Yes" however attempting to bulk edit fields as FALSE seems to result in no changes to individual metadata i.e. leaves them as "Unknown" rather than "No".

These are the fields affected:
Consanguinity
Other Affected Relatives
Fertility medications
Intrauterine insemination
In vitro fertilization
Intra-cytoplasmic sperm injection
Gestational surrogacy
Donor egg
Donor sperm

title: The Google Storage access token is expiring sooner than expected (which is 1 hour).
body:
The IGV API provides a proxy for downloading data from Google Storage. We use Redis to cache the Google access token with a fixed expiration time of 1 hour. But the token actually expires sooner because it could be generated earlier than the time when it is being fetched.

The consequence of the issue is that the Google storage accesses will fail during the time between the token expires and the cache expires.

We need to get the expiration time for the token before we cache the token.

title: Bug report, variant has no tag in tsv list
body:
This is a bug report, 

1-145826478-G-A, family RGP_421 as an example

As far as I can tell [1-145826478-G-A](https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/results/aa0024d8af1025d9974ace6f752cbed2?page=1&sort=xpos) variant has a review tag in seqr. But when i download "[all RGP variants](https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/project/R0384_rare_genomes_project_gen/saved_variants)" or "[all Review tagged RGP variants](https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/project/R0384_rare_genomes_project_gen/saved_variants/Review)" as a tsv file the "Review" tag is not listed in column "tags". The column is empty. What's the reason for this tag not being stated in the tags column?

No tag when [downloading all RGP variants here](https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/project/R0384_rare_genomes_project_gen/saved_variants), row 182.
No tag when [downloading all RGP review variants here](https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/project/R0384_rare_genomes_project_gen/saved_variants/Review), row 146. (but it is listed as review as I have selected to only show review tags)
but
Tag [is here](https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/results/aa0024d8af1025d9974ace6f752cbed2?page=1&sort=xpos) when I search for the variant and download the tvs for only that variant here (tags_1, which is the one for family RGP_421)

Using seqR to filter RGP variants with review tag I get 1610 unique missense variants. 223 of them do not have the review tag noted in the "tags" column. 

thanks
Sanna

title: seqr log out issue
body:
**Describe the bug**
Being logged out of seqr automatically once-twice a day. Not as frequent as the last time I put in a ticket, but I do lose progress/ notes that are not saved.

title: MNV export logic not working as expected
body:
**Describe the bug**
Related to ticket https://github.com/broadinstitute/seqr/issues/1865.  There are a couple behaviors that are not occurring as expected.  

- The manually created variant should not be exported as part of the variant list, only the seqr generated variants should be in the export.  So in the example below 1912634-C-T, 19-1912633-G-T should be in the AnVIL report but 19-1912632-GC-TT should not.
- The message for the MNVs (The following variants are part of the multinucleotide variant, [INSERT MANUAL MNV NAME]) the Manual name should include the c. and p. (if available) as well as the G. In this example below the message should read "The following variants are part of the multinucleotide variant 19-1912632-GC-TT (c.586_587delinsTT, p.Ala196Leu): 19-1912634-C-T, 19-1912633-G-T"

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**
Example: https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/project/R0384_rare_genomes_project_gen/saved_variants/family/F021070_rgp_312
[Rare Genomes Project_Genomes_PI_Discovery.xlsx](https://github.com/broadinstitute/seqr/files/6810472/Rare.Genomes.Project_Genomes_PI_Discovery.xlsx)

title: Permissions error setting up local install
body:
Hi,

I'm trying to set up a new local install with docker on Ubuntu 20.04, but the elasticsearch container exits straight away as "unhealthy". Elasticsearch container logs show permission denied error (copy attached).

If I change the permissions on the data directory and try again then setup appears to complete and I can create the superuser, but then I get a blank page when I go to localhost - log from seqr container also attached. 

I have LZMA command line tool 9.22 and LZMA SDK 9.22

What am I doing wrong?

[docker_elasticsearch_log.txt](https://github.com/broadinstitute/seqr/files/6805081/docker_elasticsearch_log.txt)
[docker_seqr_log.txt](https://github.com/broadinstitute/seqr/files/6805082/docker_seqr_log.txt)

title: Variant search issue
body:
**Describe the bug**
I saved my own recessive permissive search (using the criteria for recessive permissive in the RGP workflow) and tried to look for the "answer" to case 0985 in Exome Project L (compound het Pro2219Leu;Pro126Leu variants in PKD1). This returned 17 variants including the Pro2219Leu variant and a 3'UTR variant in PKD1, but Pro126Leu was not there. I then clicked on Gene Search to see all variants in PKD1 and the Pro126Leu variant STILL doesn't show up. However, if I just apply my saved recessive permissive search again after doing the gene search, all of the sudden there are 48 variants and the Pro2219Leu and Pro126Leu variants are both returned. I've replicated this multiple times.

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**
https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/results/d11e3211b3e34ef872c2637f34f1ace0?page=1&sort=pathogenicity

**Scope of the bug**
Other analysts have reported fluctuating numbers of variants being returned from their variant searches as well

title: GTEx expression not displaying on gene page
body:
**Describe the bug**
The gene page is no longer displaying GTEx data. 

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**
Example search:
https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/results/577b2fe25e5e8cb0b283b896c1eb1a8e?page=1&sort=xpos

**Scope of the bug**
Seen in both the Walsh project and RGP project. Haven't checked others. 

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44381119/118170832-951e8a00-b3f8-11eb-94c0-ca711032893f.png)

title: NO CALL showing for all SVs
body:
**Describe the bug**
All exome gCNV calls are being displayed as NO CALL. This is happening in both saved variants and new searches and across multiple projects. 

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**
https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/results/d4dd7fb3c82265968b890600cba29e03?page=1&sort=xpos

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44381119/118169708-40c6da80-b3f7-11eb-8c6f-aef003403c1f.png)

title: Incorrect X chromosome deletion in males from several families
body:
A deletion involving almost the whole X chromosome is being called by seqr in a male in this family: 
https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/project/R0408_cmg_perth_wes/saved_variants/family/F029313_uwa_lai16137

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84086816/117996182-ee5ebe80-b30f-11eb-82ee-d21cd688e73b.png)

This has been discussed with Anne O'Donnell and we think that most likely there has been a sex mix up and this sample has somewhat been analyzed as a female hence looking like a X was missing. The 2MB on Xp that is not reported to be included in the deletion by Seqr might be an artefact/a region difficult to sequence in the genome. 

The same deletion is called in males from several other families (example: https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/project/R0528_cmg_engle_wes/saved_variants/family/F029149_eng_tf)

title: too_long_frame_exception in gene breakdown
body:
For search https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/results/37c6eda3db860dc1679c5555a9e2999a?page=1&sort=pathogenicity
search works fine but gene breakdown throws an `InvalidIndexException: too_long_frame_exception ` in `get_index_metadata`

title: Data too large, data for [<http_request>]
body:
Hi!

I have installed seqr (by docker-compose) successfully, but have an issue with some data loading.

Hail version: 0.2.61-3c86d3ba497a
Error summary: TaskCompletionListenerException: is.hail.relocated.org.elasticsearch.hadoop.rest.EsHadoopRemoteException: circuit_breaking_exception: [parent] Data too large, data for [<http_request>] would be [1033764896/985.8mb], which is larger than the limit of [1020054732/972.7mb], real usage: [1033764896/985.8mb], new bytes reserved: [0/0b], usages [request=0/0b, fielddata=1882048/1.7mb, in_flight_requests=0/0b, accounting=28467488/27.1mb]

As I understood I need to increase java heap size?
But where I can do it?

Thank you in advance for your help.

UPDATE:
Problem solved.
docker-compose exec elasticsearch bash -c "sed -i 's/-Xms1g/-Xms8g/' /usr/share/elasticsearch/config/jvm.options"
docker-compose exec elasticsearch bash -c "sed -i 's/-Xmx1g/-Xmx8g/' /usr/share/elasticsearch/config/jvm.options"
docker-compose restart elasticsearch

Good GQ and IGV reads support the alt variant. **Link to page(s) where bug is occurring** https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/results/51af017fb606cfd0838da69e7cdeeab5?page=1&sort=protein_consequence **Scope of the bug** Case specific currently, but has occurred on others. **Screenshots**

body:
**Describe the bug**
Being logged out and requiring to log back in every 10-15 minutes. 

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**
Any page in seqr, across multiple projects, for more than 1 analyst

**Scope of the bug**
Seqr-wide

**Screenshots**
NA

title: Duplicates appearing when using multiple indices: issue with sort
body:
(We asked previously about the issue we identified in the email)

I investigated it deeper and figured out that there might be really an issue with the way variants are merged and duplicates eliminated when we have multiple indices that can contain the same variants. What happens is the following: 

Elasticsearch returns 'raw_hit.meta.sort' for each hit and it is based upon position only, not allelle, e.g.: 2178686113. Then sorted() python function sorts it based upon this number:

https://github.com/broadinstitute/seqr/blob/master/seqr/utils/elasticsearch/es_search.py#L540

So, for instance, 2-178686113-ATTTTTTTTTTTT-A' and  '2-178686113-A-ATT' have the same sort number - 2178686113. 
 
Since the results of different indices are just concatenated and then sorted by 'raw_hit.meta.sort' number, the order (allele part) gets lost which leads to variants not being adjacent and so duplicates remain.

Now, we could have tried using some function from pandas/numpy to do deduplication instead but unfortunately it might not be possible due to pagination of the results when, the same variant can come out, say, in 1-100 and in 101-200 results, but deduplication would work only for a single page of results. Or do you think its fine?

title: Error when trying to edit RGP project contact info
body:
**Describe the bug**
Every matchmaker submission autogenerates contact info for the project. For RGP, this is bloated with older users and email addresses no longer active. When I try to edit the project I receive the error below. We would like to be able to edit this freely when needed, and the current contact emails for RGP should be matchmaker@broadinstitute.org and caustint@broadinstitute.org. 

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**
https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/project/R0384_rare_genomes_project_gen/project_page

**Scope of the bug**
I have not noticed it with other projects. 

**Screenshots**
What it looks like now: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44381119/115067202-91155000-9ebe-11eb-99c7-c920f64b86c2.png)
Error when I try to edit it: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44381119/115065417-1cd9ad00-9ebc-11eb-9962-f714d47a3838.png)

title: Pulling incorrect gene name for autogenerated matchmaker emails
body:
**Describe the bug**
If you email a match that has multiple gene submissions, the automated email sometimes pulls the wrong gene name for the subject line. The example below is interesting because it pulls the correct gene name for the body text but the incorrect gene for the subject. 

**Link to page(s) where bug is occurring**
https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/project/R0384_rare_genomes_project_gen/family_page/F031029_rgp_1532/matchmaker_exchange - automated email for MAN_1768-01_D1 

**Scope of the bug**
Only happens if generating an email for a match with multiple genes submitted. Can be fixed manually if caught in time. 

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44381119/115059753-f82e0700-9eb4-11eb-861f-8a1535cb6dbd.png)

title: Readviz not working for HPC install
body:
Hi Hana,

I've got seqr working, but we have an issue with readviz. I have added the .bam and .bai files to a directory on our HPC install :

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23638585/111835799-5505c400-88ed-11eb-91ac-63a6592c4196.png)

....and successfully uploaded the mapping file (on the front end).

Individual IDs and location match up fine. I received no errors when processing the mapping file. When I try to view the reads of a variant in seqr, I see "error loading track data". 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23638585/111836138-bded3c00-88ed-11eb-995a-71443b2608f2.png)

I have checked the same .bam files are good by loading into IGV locally - no issues are found. Bams are aligned to the correct reference sequence.

Not sure what could be going on! 
-Ellie (Seaby)

title: tableName is not supplied to the FamilyTable component
body:
**Describe the bug**
There is no property `tableName` passed to the `FamilyTable` here:

https://github.com/broadinstitute/seqr/blob/master/ui/pages/Project/components/ProjectPageUI.jsx#L127

And since you generate name of the form here:

https://github.com/broadinstitute/seqr/blob/master/ui/pages/Project/components/FamilyTable/header/TableHeaderRow.jsx#L112

Form name is always **editundefinedFamiliesTable**. Minor issue, but decided to report. If you add the name in the first link, then you might need to fix the selectors:

https://github.com/broadinstitute/seqr/blob/master/ui/pages/Project/selectors.js#L152,L167

E.g. `familyTableState.familiesSearch -> (familyTableState || {}).familiesSearch`

Since `familyTableState` is going to be `undefined`

body:

python3 -m seqr_loading SeqrMTToESTask --local-scheduler \
    --reference-ht-path /seqr-reference-data/GRCh38/combined_reference_data_grch38.ht \
    --clinvar-ht-path /seqr-reference-data/GRCh38/clinvar.GRCh38.2020-06-15.ht \
    --vep-config-json-path /vep-GRCh38.json \
    --es-host elasticsearch \
    --es-index-min-num-shards 3 \
    --sample-type WES \
    --es-index ng1491g \
    --genome-version 38 \

title: Memory Leak
body:
**Describe the bug**
Memory leak found here: https://github.com/broadinstitute/seqr/blob/master/seqr/utils/elasticsearch/es_search.py#L816

**get()** dictionary method gets a reference for the **list**, not copying it, and as a result **variant_1['gene_consequences']** **gene_id list** significantly increases in size wrongly. We were able to discover that getting memory issues on that line. We fixed it using **numpy** arrays in the following way:

```
consequences = np.array(variant_1['gene_consequences'].get(gene_id, []))
consequences = np.concatenate((consequences, np.array(variant_2['gene_consequences'].get(gene_id, []))))
```

Perhaps you can just use **copy** if sticking to python lists. Also, we may investigate possible performance improvements by switching completely from python lists to **numpy** soon.

**Describe the bug**
Master branch seems to have the **flattenCompoundHet** (**variant search page**. After we do the search it appears) toggle but it does not seem to flatten the compound hets, I see no code that does it and the toggle seems to be just isolated ui that does nothing.

Are there any branches/commits that have the feature developed or partially developed that I could integrate into my code and proceed from that? As I understand the toggle should convert compound het pairs into a list of variants, remove duplicates and redraw the page perhaps in the meantime showing loading screen to avoid UI to be stuck for long.

title: Bug while adding Project on Variant Search
body:
Hi, 

Could you check whether your program crashes when you follow the steps:

1. Reload the initial dashboard with projects
2. Select a project and go to variant search page directly
3. Add another project to variant search

Basically we faced the need to introduce additional check here:

https://github.com/macarthur-lab/seqr/blob/master/ui/pages/Search/selectors.js#L137

Because when we navigate from the dashboard to variant search the projects in 'projectsByGuids' variable are not deleted and so the added project will be present in 'projectsByGuids' without the 'locusListGuids' key causing the program to crash. We needed to introduce additional check - 'locusListGuids' in projectsByGuid[projectGuid]:

```
    const projectGuidsSet = new Set((projectGuids || []).reduce((acc, projectGuid) => (
      (projectsByGuid[projectGuid] && ('locusListGuids' in projectsByGuid[projectGuid])) ?
        [...acc, ...projectsByGuid[projectGuid].locusListGuids] : acc), [], 
    )) 
```

If it does not happen for you, then just close the ticket but would be interesting to know.

title: Variant Search throws UI error - "TypeError: Cannot read property 'filter' of undefined"
body: **Describe the bug** Open any project and click "Project Variant Search" then click "Search" (or any filtered Search that returns some results). Chrome console log shows the following: ```log httpRequestHelper.js:123 TypeError: Cannot read property 'filter' of undefined at eval (selectors.js:680) at Array.reduce () at eval (selectors.js:679) at eval (index.js:76) at eval (index.js:37) at eval (index.js:89) at eval (index.js:37) at Function.mapStateToProps [as mapToProps] (FamilyVariantTags.jsx:431) at mapToPropsProxy (wrapMapToProps.js:46) at Function.detectFactoryAndVerify (wrapMapToProps.js:55) ``` After triage, here are my findings: I suspect this only happens to "Staff" users or any users who has access to multiple projects. Immediately after logging in, users are presented all projects he/she has access to and at this point, the redux state has `projectsByGuid` populated for all projects with summary info. Selecting a project and then clicking on "Project Variant Search", the redux store maintains this state for all projects in `state.projectsByGuid`. See first screenshot below. When search results return from the server and UI tries to render the results, the above 'filter' undfined error gets thrown. This is because in `ui/redux/selectors.js` -> the createSelector() for `getTagTypesByProject` has `project.variantTagTypes` as undefined for all projects (except the project under search) at that point and hence the error. Navigating to project page (bypassing project listing page) directly prevents this issue, i.e. navigating to `http://localhost:3000/variant_search/project/R0013_dt_001` then doing the same search returns no error because navigating to the project directly, the redux state already has projectsByGuid filtered to the corresponding project. See second screenshot below. As a workaround, I've changed this line (should be line 418 in `ui/redux/selectors.js`) in our codebase: `[project.projectGuid]: project.variantTagTypes.filter(vtt => vtt.name !== NOTE_TAG_NAME),` to: `[project.projectGuid]: (project.variantTagTypes || []).filter(vtt => vtt.name !== NOTE_TAG_NAME),`. **Scope of the bug** This issue is happening on my machine after merging in latest upstream/master changes (as of 2020-09-02). Latest upstream/master commit is `67f9cfd6db4870a0a618c6b88c339a712dca3ca2` - "Merge pull request #1441 from macarthur-lab/dev". This is for work at MCRI Seqr instance. There has been very little customisations, all in the backend and none in the UI. **Screenshots** our problem.

title: _get_parsed_variant_args function: end position is determined wrongly
body:
**Describe the bug**
In the function _get_parsed_variant_args we determine variant length:

https://github.com/macarthur-lab/seqr/blob/master/seqr/views/apis/saved_variant_api.py#L101

**variant_json['end']** is often missing, and we then do **len(ref) - 1** but the latter is wrong, for instance it can be just one nucleotide G, in which case you get **var_length = 0** and **xpos_start = xpos_end**

We need to use **xpos_end**, so we encountered this issue. Is there a way to determine **xpos_end** when **variant_json['end']** is absent?

Also, it might be that 'end' parameter is just not written down while searching for variants. I see 'end' in all of the variants in our Elasticsearch, but don't see it in the variant_json values that are presented on the variant search page.

(I checked also our Elasticsearch and there pos = end everywhere which seems wrong...)

title: seqr deployment fails; timeouts. Centos 7.8
body:
Greetings. With a file docker-compose.yml in place, and python 3.8.1 / docker compose in path, I follow these steps:
sudo docker-compose up -d seqr   
sudo /usr/local/docker-compose/docker-compose up -d seqr

However, reviewing those logs confirms that the first step never actually finishes, despite the promising output below.

```
Creating network "app_datasets_default" with the default driver
Creating app_datasets_redis_1         ... done
Creating app_datasets_elasticsearch_1 ... done
Creating app_datasets_postgres_1      ... done
Creating app_datasets_seqr_1          ... done
```

The logs show that all net-related download actions within the docker are timing out. Example:

` WARNING: Retrying (Retry(total=4, connect=None, read=None, redirect=None, status=None)) after connection broken by 'ConnectTimeoutError(<pip._vendor.urllib3.connection.VerifiedHTTPSConnection object at 0x7f0ab3876450>, 'Connection to pypi.org timed out. (connect timeout=15)')': /simple/django/`

Adding proxy info to a config ( /root/.docker/config.json, reference: https://medium.com/@airman604/getting-docker-to-work-with-a-proxy-server-fadec841194e) will not avail. Everything halts with thingvs like"Container "4e19a6c5f903" is unhealthy." 

In addition to the timeouts, I see mention of a non-existent host postgres. I assume that was to have been created within the docker environment:
`psycopg2.OperationalError: could not translate host name "postgres" to address: Name or service not known`

The environment is an oVirt VM running Centos 7.8.
Do you have any leads on the conditions needed to get seqr running? We there special firewall exceptions needed outside of docker?

title: Recessive SV search
body: **Describe the bug** A CN=0 in the proband does not show if either parent is not CN=1. Another way to put it is, if the parents are not het, seqr does not show homozygous SV in the proband as it maybe a Mendelian violation. Typically, seqr shows all SNVs the proband is homozygous for, regardless of parental status. This is how we get the potential UDP/ parental del flag. Seqr must also show all homozygous SV calls in the proband, regardless of the parental status. **Link to page(s) where bug is occurring** SV example: https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/variant/prefix_104962_DEL/family/F020347_fam44 Search page: https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/results/1ac18d09e833d72f8f8821f657cc49a5?page=1&sort=xpos **Scope of the bug** Across all projects with the SV search enabled. **Screenshots**

This bug is caused by the [Dockerfile for the seqr container cloning the entire seqr github into the container](https://github.com/macarthur-lab/seqr/blob/master/deploy/docker/seqr/Dockerfile#L97) using the hostname `localhost` instead of the Docker service names.

title: Updated options in RGP Application
body:
One question in the RGP application has updated response options. This is causing the Datstat export to fail to upload to seqr because seqr doesn't recognize the new response options. 

The updated responses are for the RELATIONSHIP field. An attached document shows all of response options. However, applicants can only see 1, 6, 7, and 8. 

I believe there is additional logic going on that combined the RELATIONSHIP and PATIENT_SEX fields in a single line when uploaded to seqr, eg. Child + Male = Son; Myself + Female = Myself (female). This seems like it would be more complicated to do with the new options for child (7, and 8), so it would be fine to have the responses to RELATIONSHIP and PATIENT_SEX appear in seqr on two different lines instead of in the same line (mocked up on attached document).  

Please feel free to reach out with questions. Thanks!
[seqr RELATIONSHIP field edits.pdf](https://github.com/macarthur-lab/seqr/files/4644788/seqr.RELATIONSHIP.field.edits.pdf)

title: Upload BAM from local files
body:
Hello --

First thanks for making seqr available on github! We are trying out the application -

 I have made a tsv file for some BAMS and used the seqr upload links
navigating from seqr:ProjectPage->Edit Datasets->Add BAM/CRAM Paths->

using and the Tab Seperated File(tsv) option the file "id2bam.tsv" is selected by seqr and we get 

"Parsed 1 rows from id2bam.tsv" ...

using
1)<ID> tab <UNIX sym-link to a BAM file>
2)<ID> tab <file://<UNIX sym-link to a BAM file>
3)<ID> tab <UNIX path to a BAM file>
4)<ID> tab <file://<UNIX path to a BAM file>

errors are
1) sym-linked and 3) actual path:
Error updating 360372: error accessing "/tmp/<bam>" (400)

2) symlinked with file:// and 4) root path with file:// 
Error updating 360372: incomplete format (400)

I have not tried uploading from a google storage bucket yet. I know it is probably something really simple but I cannot get this two-column format to upload with an id and bam path from the interface:-/. Yes there is a bam index there too and so I think we don't have something configured correctly yet... 

Then we have a local installation of elastic search and would like to use it with seqr are there instructions for ways to extract transform and upload to a (non-cloud) local elastic search instance from a local multi-vcf file or set of vcf files?  Need help with the documentation and instructions on the functionality of seqr?

You can email me directly if this forum is not appropriate - we have a few other issues 
Can we get the system for python 3.
Uploading test data in general how to set up our cloud vs local (preferred)
How to do the elastic search/hail cloud parts...

thank you!

Daniel J McGoldrick
mcgold@uw.edu

title: Add bam paths interface not working for local files
body:
I have a local install of seqr, and did the last git pull yesterday. Everything else is working fine, but when I try to add bam paths I get this error:

`Error updating 103484-002-004: (400)`

The gunicorn logs do not reveal much more information:

```
 - - [04/Dec/2019:01:10:04 +0000] "POST /api/project/R0004_proov/upload_alignment_dataset HTTP/1.0" 200 3484 "https://seqr.kliinikum.ee/project/R0004_proov/project_page" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/78.0.3904.87 Safari/537.36"
 - - [04/Dec/2019:01:10:05 +0000] "POST /api/individual/I0000054_103484_002_002/update_alignment_sample HTTP/1.0" 400 2 "https://seqr.kliinikum.ee/project/R0004_proov/project_page" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/78.0.3904.87 Safari/537.36"

```

In the settings.py file I changed the relevant fields as follows: 

```
# Readviz
READ_VIZ_BAM_PATH = ''
READ_VIZ_CRAM_PATH = ''
```

The exact same file I am trying to upload with bam paths worked in the old schema with set_bam_paths command, but now it is fully depracated.

Any ideas if I could try anything else? Or is it a bug? I saw an open issue similar to this one, but with different error message, and posted long time ago, so decided to open a new issue.

Thanks!

title: Deselected annotation filters not working?
body:
If I analyze this family for CHD5 variants using the "all" and moderate to high impact variant filters of high quality, I come up with this variant:
https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/results/10ba901793c325f2d4694bcb0846ad28?page=1&sort=xpos

When I use the same filters, except deselect "moderate to high impact", I get nothing:
https://seqr.broadinstitute.org/variant_search/results/a40e870aa046d3398b70d44e659af878?page=1&sort=xpos

In previous versions of seqr, deselecting variant annotations enabled a search of all coding or noncoding variants in a gene or proximal regulatory variants annotated with that gene's name, so was a really comprehensive way of searching for noncoding 2nd hits in high-priority candidate genes. Is this no longer the case?

title: Variant search not working for samples moved between families
body:
A couple of samples in the Pierce cohort were moved between families (such as PIE_OGI709_001414_1 from OGI709 to OGI1213 and PIE_OGI269_000576_1 into OGI841) using the new family renaming feature. A collaborator followed up trying to analyze the newly corrected family and found that variant searches aren't working. It looks like the moved samples are showing up as no call and are messing up family-wide searches for anything dependent on their genotype.

The VCF for these samples seems to be fine and Mike has been able to successfully run relatedness checks since the move.

I've heard Eleina has also had issues on this with Myoseq samples, and those may be the ones that Ben moved over the summer. I'll follow up once I can confirm this with her and Jaime.

Thanks!

title: Phenotype data gone missing!
body:
Collaborators for the CMG_Wilkins-Haug_Exomes inputted phenotype data in phenotips for all the cases with exome data available (WILK_BWH001 -> WILK_BWH006, WILK_MGH001, WILK_MGH002 and WILK_NWH001. The data were added to the "diagnostics" section in phenotips between the end of October and the beginning of Nov. 

Today the collaborator noticed the phenotype information was missing when I could not find it (I have been unable to find any phenotype information since I was given the cohort 2 weeks ago, except for case WILK_BWH001). 

The collaborators are adamant that the information was saved and has disappeared. They are obviously keen to recover it if possible.
Thank you!

title: Fix family table width on browser width reduction

Example:
![screen shot 2018-08-01 at 4 53 43 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38658973/43548326-a5d955aa-95ab-11e8-9bd9-e49eb7214c3e.png)

title: Custom inheritance "2 or more alt alleles" filter not working as expected
body: Hi team, We noticed when that we often see genes in the results of a custom inheritance "2 or more alt alleles" search with only a single variant. Here are a couple examples (RNF19B and FOXO6 only have one variant each): It seems like there should be a second check after applying the filters to make sure that all of the genes still have 2 or more alt alleles passing filters, and if not to not report the (single) variant for that gene. Thanks.
